t: Isaiah 51
The Lord Comforts Zion
“Listen*pn to Me, you who follow after righteousness, You*ld who seek the Lord:*s Look*ld to the rock from*i which*i you were hewn, And*ld to the hole of the pit from*i which*i you were dug.
Look*ld to Abraham your father, And*ld to Sarah who*i bore you; For*ld I called him alone, And*ld blessed him and increased him.”

For*ln the Lord*s will comfort Zion, He*ld will comfort all her waste places; He*ld will make her wilderness like Eden, And*ld her desert like the garden of the Lord;*s Joy*ld and gladness will be found in it, Thanksgiving*ld and the voice of melody.
“Listen*ln to Me, My people; And*ld give ear to Me, O My nation: For*ld law will proceed from Me, And*ld I will make My justice rest As*ld a light of the peoples.
My*ld righteousness is*i near, My*ld salvation has gone forth, And*ld My arms will judge the peoples; The*ld coastlands will wait upon Me, And*ld on My arm they will trust.

Lift*ld up your eyes to the heavens, And*ld look on the earth beneath. For*ld the heavens will vanish away like smoke, The*ld earth will grow old like a garment, And*ld those who dwell in it will die in like manner; But*ld My salvation will be forever, And*ld My righteousness will not be abolished.
“Listen*ln to Me, you who know righteousness, You*ld people in whose heart is*i My law: Do*ld not fear the reproach of men, Nor*ld be afraid of their insults.
For*ld the moth will eat them up like a garment, And*ld the worm will eat them like wool; But*ld My righteousness will be forever, And*ld My salvation from generation to generation.”
Awake,*ln awake, put on strength, O*ld arm of the Lord!*s Awake*ld as in the ancient days, In*ld the generations of old. Are*ild You not the*i arm*i that cut Rahab apart, And*ild wounded the serpent?
Are*iln You not the*i One*i who dried up the sea, The*ld waters of the great deep; That*ld made the depths of the sea a road For*ld the redeemed to cross over?
So*ld the ransomed of the Lord*s shall return, And*ld come to Zion with singing, With*ld everlasting joy on their heads. They*ld shall obtain joy and gladness; Sorrow*ld and sighing shall flee away.
“I,*ln even*i I, am*i He who comforts you. Who*ld are*i you that you should be afraid Of*ld a man who*i will die, And*ld of the son of a man who*i will be made like grass?

And*ld you forget the Lord*s your Maker, Who*ld stretched out the heavens And*ld laid the foundations of the earth; You*ld have feared continually every day Because*ld of the fury of the oppressor, When*ld he*i has*i prepared to destroy. And*ld where is*i the fury of the oppressor?
The*ld captive exile hastens, that he may be loosed, That*ld he should not die in the pit, And*ld that his bread should not fail.
But*ld I am*i the Lord*s your God, Who*ld divided the sea whose waves roared— The*ld Lord*s of hosts is*i His name.

And*ld I have put My words in your mouth; I*ld have covered you with the shadow of My hand, That*ld I may plant the heavens, Lay*ld the foundations of the earth, And*ld say to Zion, ‘You are*i My people.’”
God’s Fury Removed
Awake,*pn awake! Stand*ld up, O Jerusalem, You*ld who have drunk at the hand of the Lord*s The*ld cup of His fury; You*ld have drunk the dregs of the cup of trembling, And*ild drained it*i out.
There*ild is*i no one to guide her Among*ld all the sons she has brought forth; Nor*ld is*i there*i any*i who takes her by the hand Among*ld all the sons she has brought up.
These*ld two things*i have come to you; Who*ld will be sorry for you?— Desolation*ld and destruction, famine and sword— By*ld whom will I comfort you?
Your*ld sons have fainted, They*ld lie at the head of all the streets, Like*ld an antelope in a net; They*ld are full of the fury of the Lord,*s The*ld rebuke of your God.
Therefore*ln please hear this, you afflicted, And*ld drunk but not with wine.

Thus*ld says your Lord, The*ld Lord*s and your God, Who*ild pleads the cause of His people: “See,*ld I have taken out of your hand The*ld cup of trembling, The*ld dregs of the cup of My fury; You*ld shall no longer drink it.

But*ld I will put it into the hand of those who afflict you, Who*ld have said to you, ‘Lie*ld down, that we may walk over you.’ And*ld you have laid your body like the ground, And*ld as the street, for those who walk over.”
